passage_text: When buying bottled water. 1  Examine the inside and outside of the bottle before you buy it. 2  Avoid bottles that have a broken seal, and report any tampering to the store manager and health officials. 3  Also, make sure the water is clear and has no material floating in it. 4  Check the label for the best-before date. 1

Besides that, the expiration date on bottled water has certain benefits for the manufacturer. Although water, in and of itself, does not go bad, the plastic bottle it is contained in does expire, and will eventually start leaching chemicals into the water.
